intro: Hypolaena purpurea, commonly known as the purple hypolaena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple to violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems, adding to its ornamental appeal. Hypolaena purpurea is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant color and unique foliage.
